tit.cmt: 以下天皇名、人名の読み方は、ブリタニカ国際大百科事典、広辞苑、kotobank.jpで確認。

sen.j: 淳和天皇（じゅんなてんのう、延暦5年（786年） - 承和7年5月8日（840年6月7日）、在位：弘仁14年4月27日（823年5月30日） - 天長10年2月28日（833年3月22日））は、平安時代初期の第53代天皇。
sen.e: Emperor JUNNA (786 - June 7th, 840) (his reign was 30th May, 823 - 22nd March 833) was the 53rd Emperor during early Heian Period.
Emperor Junna (786 - June 7th, 840) (his reign was 30th May, 823 - 22nd March 833) was the 53rd Emperor during early Heian Period.
Emperor Junna (786 - June 7, 840) (his reign was from May 30, 823 to March 22, 833) was the fifty-third Emperor during the early Heian Period.

sen.j: 弘仁元年9月13日（810年10月14日）、薬子の変後に廃太子された高岳親王（平城天皇の子）に代わって立太子した。
sen.e: After the Kusuko Incident/the Revolt of Kusuko, Prince Takaoka (Emperor HEIZEI's son) was removed from the position of Crown Prince, then Emperor JUNNA became Crown Prince on October 14, 810.
After the Kusuko Incident (Revolt of Kusuko), Prince Takaoka (Emperor Heizei's son) was removed from the position of Crown Prince, whereupon Emperor Junna became the crown prince on October 14, 810.
After the Kusuko Incident (Revolt of Kusuko), Prince Takaoka (Emperor Heizei's son) was removed from the position of Crown Prince, whereupon Emperor Junna became the crown prince on October 14, 810.

sen.j: 弘仁14年4月27日（823年5月30日）、即位。
sen.e: He succeeded to the throne on May 30th, 823.
He succeeded to the throne on May 30, 823.

sen.j: これに伴い、大伴氏が伴氏と改姓している。
sen.e: Due to this, the OTOMO clan changed the name to TOMO clan.
Consequently, the OTOMO clan changed its name to the TOMO clan.
Consequently, the Otomo clan changed its name to the Tomo clan.

sen.j: 天皇の御名と同姓なのは畏れ多いと大伴氏が判断したからだといわれている。
sen.e: This was because OTOMO clan thought having same name as the Emperor was too presumptuous.
This was because the OTOMO clan believed it was too presumptuous to have the same name as the Emperor.

sen.j: 天長10年2月28日（833年3月22日）、仁明天皇に譲位し退位。
sen.e: On March 22nd 833, he passed the imperial throne to Emperor NINMYO and abdicated the throne.
On March 22, 833, he passed the Imperial Throne to Emperor Ninmyo and abdicated.
On March 22, 833, he passed the Imperial Throne to Emperor Nimmyo and abdicated.

sen.j: 清原夏野ら良吏の登用を積極的に行い、地方の政治の荒廃を正した。
sen.e: He actively recruited government officials like KIYOHARA no Natsuno and worked to improve the decline of local politics.
He actively recruited government officials like KIYOHARA no Natsuno and worked to improve the decline of local politics.

sen.j: また土地対策を行い、税収の増加に努めた。
sen.e: He also worked on the land measures aiming to increase in tax revenues.
He also worked on land measures designed to increase tax revenues.
He also worked on land measures designed to increase tax revenues.

sen.j: また、『令義解』た『日本後紀』の編纂が行われた。
sen.e: "Ryo no Gi Ge" and "Nihon Koki" were edited.
"Ryo no Gi Ge" and "Nihon Koki" were edited.
"Ryo no Gi Ge" and "Nihon Koki" were edited.

sen.j: 表面的には比較的平穏な時代であった。
sen.e: It was relatively peaceful era on the surface.
It was a relatively peaceful era, at least on the surface.
It was a relatively peaceful era, at least on the surface.

sen.j: だが、その即位は天皇個人が望んだ皇位継承ではなく（『日本後紀』によれば、大同元年5月1日（806年5月22日）に大伴親王（当時）が父帝の死を機会に臣籍降下を願い出て皇太子（平城天皇）に慰留されている）、更に有力貴族の後ろ盾のいない息子恒貞親王が仁明天皇の皇太子になったことに不安を抱いていたと言う。
sen.e: However the succession to the throne was not Emperor JUNNA's intention, (according to "Nihon Koki", on May 22nd, 806, when his father died, Prince OTOMO asked to be descent from the Imperial Family, but he was dissuaded by Crown Prince (Emperor HEIZEI) from resigning), and he was worried that his son Prince Tsunesada, who has no back up by the court nobles, became Emperor NINMYO's Crown Prince.

However, the succession to the throne was not Emperor Junna's intention (according to "Nihon Koki," on May 22, 806, when his father died, Prince OTOMO asked to be descent from the Imperial Family, but he was dissuaded from resigning by the crown prince (Emperor Heizei)) and was worried that his son Prince Tsunesada, who lacked the support of court nobles, would become Emperor Ninmyo's crown prince.

However, the succession to the throne wasn't Emperor Junna's intention (according to "Nihon Koki," on May 22, 806, when his father died, Prince Otomo asked to be removed from the Imperial Family, but he was dissuaded from resigning by the crown prince (Emperor Heizei)) and was worried that his son Prince Tsunesada, who lacked the support of court nobles, would become the crown prince of Emperor Nimmyo.

sen.j: 退位して太上天皇になった天皇は忠実な側近藤原吉野に親王の後事を託して崩御するが、その不安は承和の変として現実のものとなった。
sen.e: The Emperor became Dajo tenno/ex-emperor after he abdicated from the throne, he asked his close aides, FUJIWARA no Yoshino, for the Prince's future affair and died, however his worry came true as the Showa Incident.

The Emperor became Dajo tenno (ex-emperor) after he abdicated from the throne; he asked his close aides, FUJIWARA no Yoshino, to care for the prince's future affairs, but after he died his worries were realized as the Showa Incident.

The Emperor became Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) after he abdicated from the throne; he asked his close aides, FUJIWARA no Yoshino, to care for the prince's future affairs, but after he died his worries were realized as the Showa Incident.
